oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Jack Clement interviewed by Bob Allen
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is Jack Clement being interviewed by Bob Allen. The rest of the tape consists of calls made by Bob Allen to George Jones' old studio musicians.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Cowboy Jack Clement
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:25) -- Bob Allen calls Jack Clement. (0:35) -- Bob Allen explains that he's writing music notes for a Time Life album for George Jones. (0:39) -- Bob Allen asks Jack Clement about "A Girl I Used To Know," and "She Thinks I Still Care." (1:10) -- Jack Clement explains the making of the record "She Thinks I Still Care." Jack Clement owned a recording studio in Beaumont, Texas. George Jones would often stop by to record. (1:54) -- Bob Allen asks about time period Jack Clement wrote "A Girl I Used To Know." (2:15) -- Jack Clement mentions that he also wrote "Not What I Had In Mind" for George Jones. (4:15) -- Jack Clement mentions he showed George Jones "A Girl I Used To Know" in his recording studio in Beaumont, Texas (1961-1965) named "Gulf Coast Recording Studios." (4:31) -- Jack Clement produced the track "Patches" by Dickie Lee down in his Beaumont, Texas recording studio. (5:32) -- Bob Allen asks about George Jones' personal life. (6:30) -- Bob Allen asks about a guy named Darrell Edwards who used to hang out with George Jones. (8:28) -- Jack Clement mentions that George Jones owned a restaurant in Vidor, Texas, a small town outside of Beaumont. George Jones' parents lived around Vidor, Texas. (9:25) -- Jack Clement mentions that he wrote another version of "A Girl I Used To Know." (10:58) -- Jack Clement mentions that he's working on a Johnny Cash album. (20:56) -- Bob Allen discusses his and the caller's frustration with the Bob Wills' Time Life project made recently. Photographs were used that were commonly available, instead of rare photos that were sent in. (28:34) -- Caller mentions steel guitar player Bobby Garrett. (29:05) -- Luther Nalley in Beaumont, Texas. (29:40) -- Bob Allen asks about "Little" Red Hayes. (30:27) -- Bob Allen discusses the trickiness of songwriting. (35:09) -- Starday's house band - Hal Harris (lead guitar), Herb Remington (steel guitar), Doc Lewis (piano).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Clement, Jack;
